intro: Hieracium fredesianum, commonly known as the Fredesburg hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium fredesianum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in certain environments.
